name: Puerto Velas
description: This is a club with a sandy beach and has a grassy rigging area.

name: La Boca
description: Really big beach, big extensions, sea is 1000 ft from the street plus 300 ft in low tide. No rocks or concrete, nice sand. Plenty space for launching and landing.

name: Playa Horizonte
description: The beach is wide with no special regulations. Nice and soft sand. You can drive there with a 4x4. In winter there is nobody there, but in the summer it is full of people, but you can ride anyway, because there is plenty of space for launching.

name: Waikiki
description: Medium sized, sandy beach. Many people on the beach from December until February.

name: Playa Grande
description: Medium sized beach, packed during summer.

name: El Desierto
description: Big, sandy beach. Packed with beach goers most of the year.

name: Carilo
description: Very large beach, nice and soft sand. No rocks, no reefs. Full of space to launch and land except during summer (January and February), when the beach will be full of people. You can drive your 4x4 up to the beach.

name: Cumbuco
description: Long, sandy beach. Several kilometers long, can hold hundreds of kiters. Lots of space, only in front of the Eco Paradise it gets packed during season. On high tide the beach can get very narrow at some spots. Horses and cars on the beach, pay attention when launching and landing.

name: Paracuru Kitebeach
description: The beach is very big and nice white sand. Plenty space to launch kites at low tide, gets narrow on high tide. But to the left and right of the restaurant you will find lots of space.

name: Barra
description: The beach has a pretty good area to launch and land the kite, no concrete, no buildings, just sand and coconuts trees. Only some cars can be park around the lagoon. Sand on the northern top and grass and barracas on the South side. Weekends can get really crowded with locals, there are windsurfers too and on the shores many people, swimmers and bathers. During the week there's no people, only kiters.

name: Taiba
description: Big sandy beach with lots of space.

name: Ilha
description: The size of the sandy beach depends on the tide. Gets very small on high tide, but lots of space on low tide. Be careful at low tide, then the sand can get very slickly.

name: Jericoacoara
description: This is a 20 km long beach with nothing dangerous. Miles and miles of empty sandy beach. Packed sand perfect for rigging, launching and landing with ease and safety. No obstructions except for a sand dune off to the side.

name: Lagoa
description: Very big, sandy beach. Sand around the lagoon. Lots of space. Rocks to the left and right of the channel to the other lagoon - very dangerous! Some cars park along the lagoon, do not launch upwind of them.

name: Ibiraquera
description: The beautiful beach is perfectly safe since it is a long sandy beach without any dangerous rocks downwind from the point. So you can land and launch your kite safely.

name: Barra
description: Very nice beach. Lots of space, white and soft sand, some rocks but no big deal at all. In Barra do Cunhau you have different possibilities to start and land your kite: directly at the lagoon with onshore wind and normally enough place depending on the tide. To the left beach sise with sideshore wind with big start and land area. Or on the other site of the lagoon on the right beachside with sideonshore wind and place for 300 kites.

name: Icaraizinho
description: Beautiful unspoiled beach, nice soft sand, no shells, no pebbles, plenty of space to launch and land kite.

name: Puclaro
description: Beach with hard sand. The beach is not safe. Is getting better all the time, but you need to look out for rocks. Wind on the shore is gusty, ask local schools for advise if it's your first time there. Boots are highly recommended.

name: Pichidangui
description: Nice and soft sand, a bit crowded in summer season, but plenty space to launch and land. 3 miles long beach.

name: Matanzas
description: Sandy beach. The launch is easy, self landing almost impossible, all landings sketchy.

name: Laguna Cahuil
description: It's a small lagoon at the sea, with sand at the shore. Lots of space to land and launch kites. The spot is located 6 km south from Pichilemu.

name: Isla Santa Maria
description: The beach is very clean, though you probably will need someone to help you launch your kite, there is no sand, there are pebbles and small rocks, there is enough space to launch the kite, no special entries other than where everybody meets on the weekends.

name: Las Machas
description: Nice and very long beach, lots of space to launch the kite, no special entries, just find your spot and go ride.

name: Rocas
description: Lots of space. Very long sand beach, about 20km long. You need a 4x4 to drive on the beach.

name: Rocas
description: Lots of space. Very long sand beach, about 20km long.

name: El Tranque Ovalle
description: Nice grass beach, wide open, lots of space for launch and land. Entry to water very slippery, the use of boots is recommended.

name: La Boquilla
description: Super wide beach, miles long. Sandy beach. Save spot for beginners.

name: Cabo
description: Soft sand beach, lots of room for safety launch and land kites, uninhabited area, very extreme, one side of the beach is near a desert, this area is suitable for landkiting.

name: Puerto Velero
description: Many huts along the coast for beach-goers. Not much space to launch. Mostly launched where the car parks, directly behind the huts. The beach on the ocean side has lots of driftwood, so better launch your kite just behind the beach.

name: San Andres Island
description: Small beach, just line length wide. Sunbathers around. Not a beginner's spot. Beach more packed during Sundays.

name: San Andres Island
description: Beautiful white sand. Small beach, but it is quiet wide. Can be packed with tourists.

name: San Andres Island
description: Beautiful white sand. Very small beach. Can be packed with tourists.

name: Lago Calima
description: Rocks with grass around the lake.

name: Nuqui Kite Beach
description: It is a natural dark sandy beach, absolutely virgin. Millions of pebbles are washed up on shore. They are all smooth though so no problem with injuries or kites being torn.

name: Olimpica
description: It is a natural dark sandy beach, absolutely virgin. Millions of pebbles are washed up on shore. They are all smooth though so no problem with injuries or kites being torn. The beach is about 7 miles long.

name: Laguito
description: Small launch, not for beginners. Quiet some people on the beach, specially during the weekend.

name: Santa Marianita
description: It is a 300m wide, long beach (4 km) so space is no problem for riding as well as for landing and launching. With no major development, the beach is a great natural place for kitesurfing. The sand is soft, with no rocks or pebbles or too many shells so rigging is possible on the sand. There are one or two small huts right on the beach where one can have great, cheap seafood and a drink. One of them even has an air compressor for kiters.

name: El Murcielago
description: El MurciÃ©lago is the beach closest to the city, 5 minutes walk from the center of town. Nice and wide beach, no rocks, or pebbles. This beach was host to the 1991 South American Windsurfing Championship.

name: Barbasquillo
description: Barbasquillo is the beach upwind from el MurciÃ©lago.

name: Mancora
description: Sandy beach. November, December and January busiest months, but not really the windy season, so of no consequence. Beaches are never really crowded, as there is so much beach.

name: Lobitos
description: The beach is huge and there is nothing around. The point is a sand point that build off rocks at the top.

name: Pacasmayo
description: Big sandy beach with lots of space.

name: Paracas Bay
description: It is a desert beach with some houses developing around. The beach is at the border of the natural reserve, therefore we will not get houses spoiling the amazing winds. It is hard sand and some compacted dust as there is quiet often the "Paracas winds". There is enough space to launch and land kites.

name: Tres Cruces
description: The beach is amazing. It is really out in the middle of no where. It is a striking bay that is lined by white sand. You will very rarely see anyone out in this area.

name: Playon
description: Long, sandy beach. Lots of space. Rarely anyone around, only at weekends a few riders. Be aware that it is a nature reserve.

name: Zarate
description: The beach has plenty of launching space, and it is covered by pebbles. There can be some sea urchins inside. It is a natural reserve beach.

name: San Andres
description: There is a perfect beach to take off with enough space for safety in the close north of the fishing terminal with a sandy beach. There are some round small rocks around on the beach.

name: Mendieta
description: Long, sandy beach. Lots and lots of space. Beach forms a small bay.

name: Laguna Grande
description: Big beach with lots of space and access to the ocean or lagoon.

name: Malvin
description: The beach looks nice, fine sand, not too wide, at the left of the beach there are rocks.

name: Laguna Garzon
description: The beach is a paradise, uncrowded, very wide, very long. The sand is very nice.

name: El Coche
description: Nice white and soft sandy beach with plenty of space, no rocks, few shells, plenty of space to launch and land kites. About 2km long beach. Since it is a bay you still can go a bit downwind and won't need rescue. The best zone of the beach is the Northern zone, because there aren't swimmers or boats. But you can kitesurf in the whole beach as long as you are careful with the rest of the people.

name: Isla Margarita
description: The beach is awesome full of palm trees. Nice white soft sand. There are special area for launch and land kites, which is very tiny. Many beach bars, restaurants and hotels. Limited space on the beach.

name: Adicora
description: Sandy Beach (a little bit dirty), no rocks, no shells, lots of space for safe launch and landing. Some branches in the beach and in the water.

name: El Coche
city: San Pedro de Coche, La Uva
description: Sandy beach with some small plants. A bit narrow with cliffs in the background. Enough space to launch safely.

name: Isla Margarita
description: Sandy beach with lots of space for launching kites.

name: Los Roques
description: Small sand beach, with grassy areas.

name: El Coche
description: Big wide open beach, white sand. Half circle bay to the left.

name: Los Roques
description: Only soft white sand, big enough to launch safely.

name: Cayo Varadero
description: Soft white sand, enough room to launch. The best place is at the right just in front of the flat water. The beach has a half U shape what makes it perfect for beginners, it also has sideshore wind that will take you to the shore in case of an emergency.
